message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

The paper describes a method for sentence classification using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) with pre-trained language models, which is a common approach in natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The use of tri-training, a semi-supervised bootstrapping mechanism, suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) or artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The task of suggestion mining involves identifying suggestions or recommendations from text, which is a subtask of information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the paper's focus on domain adaptation and cross-domain suggestion mining suggests that it may also fall under the category of neural networks (cs.NE).
